title: Trump administration proposes rolling back protections for big tech
text: The U.S. Justice Department proposed on Wednesday that Congress take up legislation to curb protections big tech platforms like Alphabet's Google and Facebook have had for decades, a senior official said, following through on President Donald Trump's bid to crack down on tech giants.

title: Loup Ventures' Gene Munster says this is how the DOJ's crackdown could impact Big Tech
text: Loup Ventures' Gene Munster on how internet stocks could react to a possible DOJ crackdown.

title: Department of Justice proposal would limit Sec. 230 liability shield
text: The Department of Justice is taking aim at tech’s liability shield with a new set of legislative proposals. The proposed reforms are the latest action aiming to weaken legal protection established through a 1990s law known as Section 230, which protects online platforms from being held liable for content their users’ post on their sites. CNBC's Ylan Mui reports.

title: Why Facebook's WhatsApp Launched Its Payments Service In Brazil
text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB)-owned WhatsApp has launched its first rollout of payments on the platform in Brazil.

title: Facebook to launch ad spend trackers for U.S. Senate and House races
text: Facebook will now allow the public to track exactly how much U.S. senatorial and congressional candidates are spending on political ads on the company's social networks.

title: U.S. Justice Department proposes rolling back protections for big tech
text: The U.S. Justice Department proposed on Wednesday that Congress take up legislation to curb protections that big tech platforms like Alphabet's  Google and Facebook  have had for decades, a senior official said, following through on U.S. President Donald Trump's bid to crack down on tech giants.

title: DOJ takes aim at law that shields tech companies from lawsuits over material their users post
text: The proposal follows an executive order on social media signed by President Donald Trump last month.

title: Mark Zuckerberg pens op-ed, promises to help register 4 million voters
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin details a new op-ed from Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg promising changes to the platform.

title: Facebook closes loophole in political ads ahead of US elections
text: Facebook said this week it will close what critics have called a glaring loophole when it comes to disclosures on political ads.

title: Justice Department To Propose Curbing Legal Protections For Online Platforms, Report Says
text: A Trump official has said that the DOJ will propose limiting Section 230 legal protections for online platforms like Facebook and Twitter.

title: 'It's an interesting moment for the soul of Facebook'—Cramer on DOJ proposal to limit Big Tech prote
text: The White House is expected to unveil a new executive order Thursday that would direct federal agencies to exercise greater oversight and regulations related to Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act, according to a working draft of the order obtained by CNBC. CNBC's Jim Cramer and David Faber discuss.

title: Facebook tests the ability to share collections of curated content more publicly
text: Facebook’s Collections, which allow users to organize content found on Facebook — like posts, photos, videos, and more —  are now becoming more broadly shareable. The company says it’s currently testing a feature in the U.S.

title: D.O.J. to Urge Rolling Back Legal Shield for Tech Companies
text: The agency will say that Congress should repeal parts of a law that has been crucial for the growth of companies like Facebook and Twitter.

title: Facebook and Instagram will allow US users to block political ads
text: Ahead of what's certain to be a contentious US presidential election, Facebook and Instagram said they will let US users turn off political ads in their feeds.

title: Capitol Report: Alphabet, Amazon and Facebook willing to have their CEOs testify before House panel, while Apple doesn’t commit
text: In the wake of news that Amazon.com Inc.’s AMZN, +1.15% Jeff Bezos is willing to testify before the House Judiciary Committee, which is conducting an antitrust investigation aimed at Big Tech, multiple published reports say Facebook Inc.

title: India’s antitrust watchdog is reviewing Facebook’s $5.7B deal with Reliance Jio Platforms
text: Facebook’s $5.7 billion investment in India’s Reliance Jio Platforms that could help the American social juggernaut make inroads into tens of millions of shops in the country is being reviewed by the local antitrust watchdog. The Competition Commission of India said on Wednesday that it is reviewing Facebook’s multi-billion investment in Reliance Jio Platforms for a […]

title: The Wall Street Journal: Justice Department to suggest limits on internet companies’ protections
text: The Justice Department is set to propose a rollback of legal protections that online platforms have enjoyed for more than two decades, in an effort to make tech companies more responsible in how they police their content, according to a Trump administration official.

title: Justice Department to propose limiting online platform protections, WSJ reports
text: The Justice Department is set to propose limiting liability protections that tech companies have on their platforms, the Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday. CNBC's Ylan Mui reports.

title: Justice Department will reportedly propose limits to online platforms' legal protections
text: It comes in the wake of President Donald Trump's executive order targeting social media sites.

title: Here’s how to turn off political ads on Facebook and Instagram
text:
Sadly, there is still no sign Facebook will attempt to improve the online political landscape by fact-checking misleading claims by politicians.
The U.S. presidential election is less than five months away, which means a political activity on Facebook is about to go into overdrive.

title: Facebook Will Allow Users To Turn Off All Political Ads
text: Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is rolling out a new feature that will let users avoid all political advertisements on its platform, Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said Tuesday.

title: Facebook plans to boost voter turnout and transparency in US elections
text: Details on how to vote will be featured prominently, and people will be allowed to opt out of seeing paid political ads

title: Facebook adds option for US users to turn off political ads, launches voting info hub
text: Beginning today, Facebook users in the U.S. will have the option to “turn off” all political advertising on the platform.
